question: Will the United Nations have exactly 193 member states on March 31, 2025?
reasoning:
Based on the information gathered:

1. As of March 6, 2025, the United Nations has 193 member states, according to both the official UN website and Wikipedia.
2. The number of UN member states has remained stable at 193 since 2011, with no new admissions or withdrawals since South Sudan joined in 2011.
3. Joining the UN requires approval from both the Security Council and the General Assembly, which is a lengthy and complex process. There are no recent announcements or developments indicating changes in UN membership.
4. The two non-member observer states, Vatican City and the State of Palestine, have not recently applied for full membership.

Given the stability in the number of UN member states and the absence of any indications of changes in the near future, it is highly probable that the number of member states will remain at 193 on March 31, 2025.

FINAL PROBABILITY: 0.95

search_results.title: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Enlargement_of_the_United_Nations
search_results.content:
---
title: Enlargement of the United Nations - Wikipedia
url: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Enlargement_of_the_United_Nations
hostname: wikipedia.org
sitename: Wikimedia Foundation, Inc.
date: 2006-07-21
---
# Enlargement of the United Nations


As of 6 March 2025, there are 193 member states in the [United Nations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Nations) (UN), each of which is a member of the [United Nations General Assembly](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Nations_General_Assembly).[[1]](https://en.wikipedia.org#cite_note-1)

The following is a [list of United Nations member states](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Member_states_of_the_United_Nations) arranged in chronological order according to their dates of admission (with the [United Nations Security Council resolutions](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Nations_Security_Council_resolution) that recommended their admission and the [United Nations General Assembly resolutions](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Nations_General_Assembly_resolution) that admitted them, signified with SCR and GAR, respectively), [2] including former members. Members denoted with "→" changed their names, had their memberships in the UN continued by a

[successor state](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Succession_of_states), merged with other members, or were dissolved.

## Timeline

[[edit](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Enlargement_of_the_United_Nations&action=edit§ion=1)]

### 1940s

[[edit](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Enlargement_of_the_United_Nations&action=edit§ion=2)]

#### 1945 (original members)

[[edit](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Enlargement_of_the_United_Nations&action=edit§ion=3)]

The UN officially came into existence on 24 October 1945, after ratification of the [United Nations Charter](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Nations_Charter) by the five permanent members of the [United Nations Security Council](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Nations_Security_Council) ([China](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republic_of_China_(1912%E2%80%9349)), [France](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Provisional_Government_of_the_French_Republic), the [Soviet Union](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soviet_Union), the [United Kingdom](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Kingdom), and the [United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States)) and a majority of the other signatories. [3] A total of 51 original members (or founding members) joined that year; 50 of them si…

content.snippet:
---
title: Enlargement of the United Nations - Wikipedia
url: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Enlargement_of_the_United_Nations
hostname: wikipedia.org
sitename: Wikimedia Foundation, Inc.
date: 2006-07-21
---
# Enlargement of the United Nations


As of 6 March 2025, there are 193 member states in the [United Nations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Nations) (UN), each of which is a member of the [United Nations General Assembly](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Nations_General_Assembly).[[1]](https://en.wikipedia.org#cite_note-1)

The following is a [list of United Nations member states](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Member_states_of_the_United_Nations) arranged in chronological order according to their dates of admission (with the [United Nations Security Council resolutions](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Nations_Security_Council_resolution) that recommended their admission and the [United Nations General Assembly resolutions](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Nations_General_Assembly_resolution) that admitted them, signified with SCR and GAR, respectively), [2] including former members. Members denoted with "→" changed their names, had their memberships in the UN continued by a

[successor state](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Succession_of_states), merged with other members, or were dissolved.

## Timeline

[[edit](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Enlargement_of_the_United_Nations&action=edit§ion=1)]

### 1940s

[[edit](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Enlargement_of_the_United_Nations&action=edit§ion=2)]

#### 1945 (original members)

[[edit](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Enlargement_of_the_United_Nations&action=edit§ion=3)]

The UN officially came into existence on 24 October 1945, after ratification of the [United Nations Charter](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Nations_Charter) by the five permanent members of the [United Nations Security Council](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Nations_Security_Council) ([China](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republic_of_China_(1912%E2%80%9349)), [France](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Provisional_Government_of_the_French_Republic), the [Soviet Union](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soviet_Union), the [United Kingdom](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Kingdom), and the [United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States)) and a majority of the other signatories. [3] A total of 51 original members (or founding members) joined that year; 50 of them si…

[Truncated preview: showing 204 words out of ~2708. Full content available via `btf_extract_evidence`.]

The UN officially came into existence on 24 October 1945, after ratification of the [United Nations Charter](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Nations_Charter) by the five permanent members of the [United Nations Security Council](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Nations_Security_Council) ([China](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republic_of_China_(1912%E2%80%9349)), [France](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Provisional_Government_of_the_French_Republic), the [Soviet Union](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Soviet_Union), the [United Kingdom](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Kingdom), and the [United States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States)) and a majority of the other signatories. [3] A total of 51 original members (or founding members) joined that year; 50 of them si…

facts.fact: The United Nations currently has 193 member states, as listed on the official UN page.

facts.title: https://www.un.org/en/about-us/member-states
facts.fact: The number of UN member states has remained stable at 193 for several years.

facts.title: https://www.un.org/en/about-us/member-states
facts.fact: Joining the UN requires approval from both the Security Council and the General Assembly, a process that can be lengthy and complex.

facts.title: https://www.un.org/en/about-us/member-states
facts.fact: There are no recent announcements or developments indicating changes in UN membership.

facts.title: https://www.un.org/en/about-us/member-states
facts.fact: The two non-member observer states, Vatican City and the State of Palestine, have not recently applied for full membership.

messages.content:
Based on the following question, analyze it carefully and provide your probability estimate.

Question: Will the United Nations have exactly 193 member states on March 31, 2025?
Background: BBC Science Focus: [How many countries are there in 2025?](https://www.sciencefocus.com/planet-earth/how-many-countries-are-there): "There are 195 recognised countries in the world, according to the United Nations. 193 of these are member states of the UN, while two countries are non-member observer states: Vatican City and the State of Palestine.  Other organisations list a different number of countries on Earth, with US intelligence agency the CIA listing 237 countries in total."
Resolution criteria: This question will resolve positively if the official number of United Nations member states is exactly 193 on March 31, 2025, when checked by Metaculus. It will resolve negatively if the number of member states is not 193. The mechanism of checking will be to access [this specific link](https://www.un.org/en/about-us/member-states) from the UN. The Admin resolving the question will hit control-F and count the number of instances of "Date of Admission" on the page.
Fine print: 
present_date: 2025-03-06T20:06:29.523390


Make sure to use the tools at your disposal to gather relevant information before providing your final probability estimate.

You may reason through the problem, but you MUST end your response with:
FINAL PROBABILITY: [your decimal number between 0 and 1]

Other organisations list a different number of countries on Earth, with US intelligence agency the CIA listing 237 countries in total.\"","resolution_criteria":"This question will resolve positively if the official number of United Nations member states is exactly 193 on March 31, 2025, when checked by Metaculus. It will resolve negatively if the number of member states is not 193. The mechanism of checking will be to access [this specific link](https://www.un.org/en/about-us/member-states) from the UN. The Admin resolving the question will hit control-F and count the number of instances of \"Date of Admission\" on the page.","fine_print":"","present_date":"2025-03-06T20:06:29.523390","date_cutoff_start":null,"date_cutoff_end":null,"scoring_weight":1.0,"resolution":"unknown","resolved_at":null,"max_queries":5}

As of 6 March 2025, there are 193 member states in the [United Nations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Nations) (UN), each of which is a member of the [United Nations General Assembly](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Nations_General_Assembly).[[1]](https://en.wikipedia.org#cite_note-1)

messages.content: {"question_id": "c0583401-760f-581e-833c-b240e6fe173d", "url": "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Enlargement_of_the_United_Nations", "facts": [{"title": "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Enlargement_of_the_United_Nations", "url": "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Enlargement_of_the_United_Nations", "fact": "As of 6 March 2025, there are 193 member states in the United Nations."}, {"title": "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Enlargement_of_the_United_Nations", "url": "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Enlargement_of_the_United_Nations", "fact": "The last change in UN membership occurred in 2011 with the admission of South Sudan."}, {"title": "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Enlargement_of_the_United_Nations", "url": "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Enlargement_of_the_United_Nations", "fact": "There have been no new admissions or withdrawals from the UN since 2011, maintaining the number of member states at 193."}, {"title": "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Enlargement_of_the_United_Nations", "url": "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Enlargement_of_the_United_Nations", "fact": "The historical trend shows that changes in UN membership are infrequent, with the last significant increase in 1992 when 13 new members were admitted."}, {"title": "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Enlargement_of_the_United_Nations", "url": "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Enlargement_of_the_United_Nations", "fact": "The UN has maintained 193 member states consistently since 2011, indicating a period of stability in membership numbers."}]}
messages.name: btf_extract_evidence

messages.content:
Based on the information gathered:

1. As of March 6, 2025, the United Nations has 193 member states, according to both the official UN website and Wikipedia.
2. The number of UN member states has remained stable at 193 since 2011, with no new admissions or withdrawals since South Sudan joined in 2011.
3. Joining the UN requires approval from both the Security Council and the General Assembly, which is a lengthy and complex process. There are no recent announcements or developments indicating changes in UN membership.
4. The two non-member observer states, Vatican City and the State of Palestine, have not recently applied for full membership.

Given the stability in the number of UN member states and the absence of any indications of changes in the near future, it is highly probable that the number of member states will remain at 193 on March 31, 2025.

FINAL PROBABILITY: 0.95
